data.title: Senate likely to stand behind referendum pick
data.description: The Senate will meet on Tuesday to vote on the referendum bill on constitutional amendments with majority of senators expected to stand firmly by the divisive double-majority rule.

data.title: Myanmar energy investments exceed $26.5 billion by November 2024
data.description: Myanmar’s energy sector had attracted more than US$26.5 billion in foreign investment as of the end of November 2024, accounting for 28.43 % of the total foreign investment, according to figures released by the Department of Investment and Companies Administration (DICA).

data.title: Thai PM arrives in Malaysia for official two-day visit
data.description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra arrived in Malaysia on Sunday (Dec 15) to begin a two-day official visit at the invitation of Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim.

data.title: SAC Chair urges end to conflicts in 50th Rakhine State Day message
data.description: Senior General Min Aung Hlaing, Chairman of the State Administration Council (SAC), urged the MNDAA TNLA and AA, to end armed conflicts in the 50th Rakhine State Day message.

data.title: Myanmar energy investments exceed $26.5 billion by November 2024
data.description: Myanmar’s energy sector had attracted more than US$26.5 billion in foreign investment as of the end of November 2024, accounting for 28.43 % of the total foreign investment, according to figures released by the Department of Investment and Companies Administration (DICA).

data.title: RBSO stages Christmas concert
data.description: The Main Hall of Thailand Cultural Centre on Ratchadaphisek Road will be filled with festive tunes during "Sound Of The Seasons" this Saturday from 7.30pm.

data.title: AI for the elderly
data.description: Healthcare workers at government hospitals face an overwhelming workload every morning due to the large number of patients. Currently, robots known as Dinsaw Intelligent OPDs assist staff in screening patients at three hospitals -- Chulalongkorn, Siriraj and Phramongkutklao.

data.title: Wage hike discussion fails to meet quorum
data.description: The tripartite wage committee will meet again next Monday to discuss the proposal to raise the nationwide daily minimum wage to 400 baht, after its meeting on Thursday collapsed due to the lack of quorum.

data.title: Artistic, with insects
data.description: When Thanapat Termsintawee was a third-year student at the School of Fine and Applied Arts, Bangkok University, he conducted a thesis which compared human society to ant colonies. Working on the thesis led him to keep ants and develop a familiarity with the insects.

data.title: Thailand wins silver in global hospitality competition
data.description: Team Thailand claimed second place at the prestigious "World Young Chef Young Waiter Young Mixologist (YYY) Competition 2024", recently held in Singapore.

data.title: Three killed as fresh floods hit four southern provinces
data.description: At least three people died in fresh flooding which battered four provinces in the South yesterday, which has affected over 43,500 households across the region to date.

data.title: 'Demon Chef' Leung fires up Dusit Thani
data.description: The Pavilion restaurant at the newly-reimagined flagship hotel Dusit Thani Bangkok is hosting "The Maverick Academy Live Showcase Dinner", tomorrow at 7pm.

data.title: Purple Line extension '50% done'
data.description: The Purple Line southern extension linking Tao Poon in Bang Sue district to Rat Burana, the southern part of Bangkok, is almost halfway complete, says the Mass Rapid Transit Authority of Thailand (MRTA).

data.title: War Elephants take over top spot
data.description: Patrik Gustavsson grabbed a second-half winner as defending champions Thailand edged Malaysia 1-0 at Rajamangala National Stadium for their second straight Asean Mitsubishi Electric Cup Group A victory to snatch the top spot in the pool.

data.title: BMA probes falling beam on Rama IV
data.description: Bangkok governor Chadchart Sittipunt ordered suspension of demolition work at the Srifuengfung Building on Rama IV Road after a concrete beam fell from a crane and damaged three vehicles on Saturday.

data.title: Govt pushes for alcohol control laws that match 'global norms'
data.description: The Alcoholic Beverage Control Bill will be submitted to parliament next month, says the Ministry of Public Health.

data.title: Shaky hold on site safety
data.description: Traffic on  Rama II Road  fully resumed on Saturday after a two-week disruption due following the mishap in which a crane carrying a concrete beam collapsed onto the road in Samut Sakhon on Nov 29, killing six workers and injured nine others.

data.title: Police raid locations linked to Soonthorn
data.description: Law enforcement agents raided five locations in Prachin Buri in connection with the case of Soonthorn Vilawan, the 85-year-old Prachin Buri Provincial Administrative Organisation president who allegedly had his adopted son killed in a political power struggle.

data.title: Hospital stops taking 30-baht patient referrals
data.description: Mongkutwattana Hospital has stopped treating outpatient referrals under the universal coverage healthcare card, or gold card scheme, to help contain financial losses.

data.title: New threats in regional drugs fight
data.description: Cross-border and multisectoral cooperation among countries in the greater Mekong subregion (GMS) is needed to mitigate illicit drugs, says the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC).

data.title: Cancer Anywhere scheme 'hurting hospitals'
data.description: Experts are urging the National Health Security Office (NHSO) to scrap the  Cancer Anywhere  (CA) programme after several major public hospitals reported operating losses due to the overwhelming number of patients requesting cancer treatment.

data.title: Thai PM arrives in Malaysia for official two-day visit
data.description: SEPANG: Thailand’s Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra arrived in Malaysia on Sunday (Dec 15) to begin a two-day official visit at the invitation of Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

data.title: Second edition of ‘workation’ project launched
data.description: The second edition of a project featuring pop-up working spaces in five destinations across Thailand was launched on Sunday in a bid to campaign “workations” in the country.

data.title: Thai PM Paetongtarn on list of 100 most powerful women in world
data.description: Prime Minister  Paetongtarn Shinawatra  is listed among the "100 World’s  Most Powerful Women  2024" by  Forbes Magazine .

data.title: Loan shark targets ministry canteen in Bangkok
data.description: Two people have been arrested in the food court at the Ministry of Culture’s office in Bangkok

data.title: Floods in 4 southern Thai provinces affect bus, train services
data.description: Flooding remained in the southern Thai provinces of Chumphon, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Ranong and Surat Thani on Sunday, hampering bus and train services.
